However, the time it takes for them to upload isn't as great. Also I'd like the idea of not having to have the app open in order for them to upload, that prevents me from multitasking which is a major minus-----. Also, it would be nice if the app once downloaded and recognize the faces of the ppl we have already set to a folder, would go to that folder automatically if that photo is a single of that person. Other than that this is a great app!!!
title: Great App but needs a little more tweaks!!

review: ‚Ä¶if I could offer a suggestion to better the experience it would be to allow at a quick glance to give total of photos&to offer a quick option to edit certain photos at a glance without having to make each choice individually like with one click & eliminate all together‚Ä¶an example would be the choice editing the post in the download faze‚Ä¶giving that option would be great for easy editing
title: üåπ‚Ä¶üì∏‚Ä¶this app is good but if there were different

review: I love this app and use it pretty much every day. A couple of things that need to be fixed are: 1. The app drops/deletes photos from your albums which you have carefully put together. This is very frustrating as you then have to add all missing photos from the album again. Is there an album overall limit I‚Äôm not aware of? This needs to be fixed. 2. The video playback is awful regardless of the device you are using. I have several iPads including the most recent and all are the same‚Ä¶ slow video loading/playback. Therefore it is the app not the device I‚Äôm using.
title: Great with some problems

review: I have no idea why the developers felt making it more difficult to see pictures on this date in history was a priority but here we are. With the new update there is no always present ‚Äúthis day in history‚Äù icon to lead you to it. You are at the mercy of the app popping up a message to view them. The problem is is it isn‚Äôt 100%. I have had multiple days now where it doesn‚Äôt pop up the ability to look at past photos despite there being photos taken on those days. Why not just have the ability to always navigate to pictures from this day in history like on previous version? Devs got too cute and ruined the best feature of the app.
title: New update ruins this day in history

review: I was using google and it switched from unlimited to a shared 15gigs within its apps that I used which maxed out immediately when the switch happened, sadly I didn‚Äôt know it was a shared 15gigs which really made inconvenient. As a Prime member I didn‚Äôt use the option until googles limitations came to fruition. Once I switched and started checking it out simply the Storage is unlimited, Photos are easy to find with keyword searches, and it was an easy switch. Definitely recommend if you are a Prime member!
title: Great Perk

review: I have loved this app for years. It is great to store my photos, share with family members through the family vault, sort my photos in albums and I love the daily memories that pop up each day showing pictures from that day each year. However, I just recently updated the app and the update is so terrible! It makes it so much more difficult to maneuver, I cannot find the family vault any longer even after watching the new video to explain the updates (does not mention family vault at all in the video). Hi have used this app daily for the past 4.5 years and is one of the best benefits for a prime membership and it seriously makes me so sad now. Please please change the app back to how it was!
title: Hate the new update

review:
Nice belt and suspenders backup for camera roll and in between manual backup syncs to local storage.
I don‚Äôt pay for the iCloud photos backup due to a 1.5 Tb library of Raw photos from DSLR‚Äôs and videos from iPhone. The time between manual syncs leaves a gap of potentially lost data in case of damaged or lost phone. So, letting this app pickup the captures in between is value added piece of mind. Plus the extra screen captures and daily snaps of deposits or grocery lists don‚Äôt need to be saved in the roll once this is synced but can be useful if needed later.
title: Great extra backup with Prim free photo

review:
I‚Äôve used it about two weeks. Upload was fast enough considering how many I had to put there. 

I feel very glad that my phone pictures are getting backed up at high resolution. I lost a year of photos from 2019 because I hadn‚Äôt backed up and my phone crashed. This gives me disaster ‚Äúwhat if‚Äù protection. 

Note doesn‚Äôt fully back up Burst mode pictures. And has size limitations on videos which if you fill up does cost more to use even if you have prime. 

Excellent features like face recognition and sharing folders. Tested out making a group and having my cousin added their own picture easy Peasy. 

I also like that features so far seem equal on the phone app as in a browser. 

It could use some improvements in finding pictures based on different characteristics like all my Live Photo‚Äôs, all my png screenshots, all my selfies. It has just a few filters and with my initial upload of a bunch at once I had a hard time with narrowing.
title: Good so far

review:
I use to have folders and folders of photos saved to a computer desktop growing up. Times are changing and I don‚Äôt have time to sit down and upload them to my laptop anymore. While it‚Äôs nice to still have that option, being able to upload photos on-the-go is a lot more desirable. And my photos can stay somewhere safe rather than on my phone.

The app is nice and clean. Easy to navigate. Does the job I was expecting. I do have one suggestion though regarding photo organization. 

Would there ever be a consideration to allow sub-albums inside of albums? For example: An album called ‚ÄúVacations‚Äù, and inside that album could be other albums like ‚ÄúDisneyland 2018‚Äù, ‚ÄúNew York 2019‚Äù, ‚ÄúBahamas Cruise 2020‚Äù, etc. That way I can more easily navigate which folders I want to get to. I‚Äôll know my vacation photos are in one album, hiking photos in another, work events in another, and so on. 

So far I‚Äôm enjoying the app.
title: Excited to see where this goes

review: This app would be perfect if I could actually organize my pictures. Keeping thousands of pictures in one big folder just isn‚Äôt a realistic way to to organize everything. Sure you can make albums but without being able to actually move pics to there own folders it‚Äôs impossible to keep track of everything. This needs a better way to organize everything. Basically create folders and move pictures. Not one big messy collection with albums.
title: I love this app but.......

Just to start off this is the best cloud photo storage app out there but here is my critique:
Without Prime you get 5gigs photos or videos
With Prime you get unlimited photos and 5 gig photos. I think this is fine. I just wish that if I were to cancel my prime account I know how much storage my photos take up. I am wondering if I cancel prime, do all the photos or videos that take up more than 5 gigs get thrown into the void. Making sure my photos are safe in any situation is important because they hold your life story.

title: Amazonian Relics

review: Love having this app although I‚Äôve had to remove it and add it back again to keep working correctly. Samsung doesn‚Äôt have this problem, which is my only complaint. This app is bar none the best Photo uploading app I have ever used, it‚Äôs even better than the popular competitor. 

This app supports Live Photo, uploads fast and it actually displays photo storage size during the upload and gives a progress bar for each upload, which i think is a really nice touch. All photos are stored in original quality and upload for free with a Prime subscription. Videos are limited to 5GB but that‚Äôs fine since this app is really best suited for photo backup. 

Thanks for making a great app.
title: The best photo uploading app ever

review: I‚Äôd love to see ways I can store photos into folders, ‚Äúfamily‚Äù ‚Äúhome‚Äù ‚Äúvacations‚Äù folders.  and search by color and name - red dress, blue ring , etc‚Ä¶ Sabrina , Sophie , etc‚Ä¶to find people by searching name. title: Great! üí´

title: It‚Äôs a nobrainer.

review: But maybe some more artistic and creative in app features like more custom views and layouts like mosaic vies based on original dimension layouts...a light table slide view, maybe similar abridged to it‚Äôs more fundamental features seen in more complex, feature rich applications and phot platforms offered by more expensive and more tailored to photographers and post camera roll digital photo developers. title: Convenient, Easy to use & a No Brainer Decision for Prime Members

review: My biggest beef is whatever is used to provide the weather. It can be really dark at my house where the trees are practically touching the ground and it‚Äôs pouring but Alexa will tell me there‚Äôs no rain in the forecast or there‚Äôs like a 11% chance. If I ask Google it tells me that it is raining and when it will be expected to stop. At this current time I asked if it was going to rain and she said no there is only an 11% chance but yet I received a thunderstorm warning for our area and it‚Äôs currently pouring outside.
title: Weather is not right 50% of time

review: So far, I am enjoying this very much because I‚Äôm finding all these photos that I have saved on flash drives in here as well without me intentionally putting them in here. review:

   It‚Äôs actually very fast & convenient!
title: It‚Äôs a lifesaver !

review: This app is superb. Firstly, it has a clean, smooth, and intuitive UI, which is the core of every app. Secondly, it has all the features Apple‚Äôs app has, plus more like overnight upload, UNLIMITED, full-resolution cloud photo storage with Prime, and complimentary 5 GB video storage (more purchasable). review: I haven‚Äôt been able to put my photos anywhere and I keep having to buy space for my phone ü•≤ but now I don‚Äôt have to worry about loosing my photos or paying for extra storage üòÑ and yes I have tried to upload and download my photos on other things but this is my game changer for my memory‚Äôsüíú my phone wiped it twice and I lost so many memories and I‚Äôm just thankful I don‚Äôt have to worry about it anymore üòÑ 10/10 am recommending

title: Great App

title: Works good for me

title: Uploading photos

review:
As others have pointed out, the app uploads photos as soon as they are take but not after they have been edited in your computer or other device. This makes the app pretty useless for anyone who does more than just take snapshots. 

It would help if there were just a switch to turn off that auto upload feature. That is not a hard thing to do from an engineering point of view. But, of course, it is possible users will then flip on that switch and start loosing their snapshots. The cries of dismay! 

So, I may have to reconsider my cloud storage options. There are no free lunches.
title: Cannot control uploads

review: This is a good substitute for other photo saving apps. It has good searchability, and has other features I haven‚Äôt really tried yet. Only down side is even if you have it set up to auto-download, make sure your pics are actually there before you delete. Sometimes my photos are not all there and I have to open the app and wait for it to completely download. Otherwise, I have no issues with it.
title: Yay! A place to save photos

review: I absolutely love it, comes in handy when you need to back up those precious photos ASAP! I realized now that I'm paying for prime, so why not take advantage of it?! I was paying for icloud, a whopping $2.99 for 200Gigs fee per month, and so I made the switch for true unlimited photo storage (minis the video back up) I'll just store them externally... Definitely so worth the money, and highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for this service.
title: Love it & Very Helpful

review: I‚Äôve been wanting to get off social media for some time, but my excuse was always that I wouldn‚Äôt have anywhere to keep my precious photos, and I take A LOT of photos. So when I discovered AmazonPhotos I was sold instantly. I LOVE this app! I love that I can create albums the same way I would to organize things on social media platforms. I also can‚Äôt wait to print my favorite photos directly from the app! That‚Äôs just way too cool! And the app is FREE and UNLIMITED!? Come on!
title: Game Changer

review: Such a time saver. It organizes all my photos and with unlimited storage I never have to worry about running out of space. I love the face detector feature so it knows who is in the picture and the search bar. The sharing features are great and allows me to share albums and updated pictures of my child with extended family members who can‚Äôt see her regularly. I recommend this app to everyone!
title: Organizes all my photos so I don‚Äôt have to!

review: I seriously am in love with this app! You can set for it to upload when opening the app. The only downfall is that you can‚Äôt close the app till it‚Äôs done or it will stop the uploading but if you have quick enough WiFi it only takes a minutes. I personally prefer it over icloud for the sake that if I delete the photos from my phone, the items stay in the app and you can have the app downloaded on multiple devices to access the pictures!
title: Been a lifesaver!

review: Absolutely love this app, great way to back up the (way to many) photos I take. Love that it has a shareable feature, my husband takes pictures that I don't, and it's great. Only thing I don't like is that I have to open it and let it sit there to sync up, even though I have that enabled. When doing that, I can't even switch to another screen. It occasionally spazzes out and says that it's uploading -- photos when it's done, but it's a free app, that sorts photos! I can't complain!
title: Great App! Love the photo Storage

review: Almost nothing about this app is user-friendly. You get notifications over the area that you‚Äôre working in so when you click on, let‚Äôs say the delete button there is a banner blocking it from the last photo that you deleted.  There are multiple issues with choosing and selecting certain photos and the app not responding or they‚Äôre being an issue why you can‚Äôt select certain photos. It‚Äôs way too difficult to delete multiple photos at once. I get so frustrated whenever I‚Äôm in this app that I end up closing out of it and not even doing any work in it
title: Needs redesigned

review: This app saves all your pictures ..there is so much space for all your pics ..it‚Äôs also awesome to have when changing devices .. no more worries about losing your photos ..and can be used on multiple devices without any problems ..easy to navigate ..nice layout ..not to mention it also has on this day looking back where it sends you memories of the past years and slide shows of the past year
title: Love this app

review:
Maybe if you have a very limited list on photos, it easier but in no way for me. I use folders to pre-organize images.  As of v.8, I can‚Äôt find the folder list anymore.  

There used to be a great search text box which seems to be replaced by buttons such as places and thinks. This is not simplistic anywhere near as simplistic. It was much more simplistic to just type ‚Äúdog‚Äù in the search then it is to scroll through hundreds of ‚Äúthings‚Äù to hopefully find dog. 

This is no longer an app to organize thousands of files from over a decade.  If the features are not brought back soon, it will be time to cancel service and find another solution.
title: App near useless since v.8.

review: It‚Äôs not as feature-rich as something like Flickr, but if you‚Äôre already paying for Prime it‚Äôs a no-brainer to use this to backup your photos. Unlimited photo storage is the draw, though you have to pay extra for video storage. I wish it had a setting to prevent it from uploading videos, which is why I took off a star. Other than that it does what it advertises and I ha w no complaints. The ‚Äúon this date‚Äù feature is fun, to see what you you were doing on this date years ago.
title: Bare bones, but very good

review: The app itself is reasonably easy to use and reliable, though should offer more control of the uploading process such as selection of which photos rather than mass uploading. The worst part of the app is the huge number of notifications turned on by default, practically taking over my phone. The worst experience of all was the pop up of whether I liked the app or not with only a Yes or No option, freezing my experience in the app until tapping through an annoying series of interactions. I would not have provided a negative review if it were not for this prompt that interrupted my time in the app.
title: Decent app but constantly nagging

review:
I have been dis outages to use memory as the first iterations of ‚Äòalbums‚Äô contained  random photos from my database that I do not particularly cared for: either the angle, or subject, etc was not memorable for me. 
Like FB or Instagram, please a have a feature where you can select your favorite photos and have those photos being part of the memory collection. That would be very meaningful and will make the collection stand out, that I would enjoy looking at overtime and share it with my loved ones.
title: Suggestion

review: Unlimited full res photos is an awesome deal for prime members. This is the prime benefit I tell everyone that they have-and-probably-didn‚Äôt-know. Besides just storage, it has all main features of Google Photos. I think it might be missing some of the artistic creations though. I also like that you can install and use app without giving permissions to your photos if you want (to just view), Google Photos requires access to local photos or else it won‚Äôt even open.
title: All around great

review: This app would be great‚Ä¶ if it worked. The app is constantly failing to perform. Overnight uploads is always a joke. You have to close the app and reopen about 5 times before it will start correctly uploading so you can leave it alone to do the overnight uploads. And even then, it sometimes will close out while you‚Äôre sleeping for no reason. Except when it won‚Äôt work at all. As of today 9/10, I haven‚Äôt been able to upload anything since 9/1. I pay extra each month to have this as my backup for photos and videos. But how is this an efficient backup if it fails to upload my pictures and video on a regular basis???
title: Great in theory, horrible in execution

review:
The new app design is obviously designed with light users in mind, to have a more modern esthetic. However, they have removed any option to search by text string. In fact, it only allows you to browse your photos by their pre-determined bot-generated categories, or to scroll though your entire collection chronologically. Mainly it just wants to feed you the photos it‚Äôs algorithm regurgitates at any given moment. 

I have a large collection. Previous to this latest update, I could search for and locate a specific photo in seconds. Now I can barely find anything I am looking for.  This app is now useless for my needs.
title: New app update no longer has Search option

review: I love this app. What an easy way to organize all of my photos! Plus it saves so much room on my phones memory. One thing I‚Äôd like to see, is a notification pop up that lets me know I‚Äôve already added a photo to an album. It‚Äôs hard to keep track if you do a lot. For instance.. I‚Äôm currently undergoing an exterior home reno and created an album. I‚Äôm constantly taking pics and can‚Äôt keep up whether I added it to album or not. Something like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve already added this to album: RENOVATION‚Äù. But regardless.. it‚Äôs a great app !!
title: Easy and highly functional

review: I only have 5 GB of storage on my phone so I can‚Äôt hold many pictures. I got this app to see if maybe it could store more pictures and I could delete things off my camera roll to make more space but still be able to have these photos. I have over 1,600 photos uploaded on the app and I still have 2 full GB left which is perfect. Great app to store more photos and videos!!! Definitely recommend this app for everyone!
title: Love Love Love

review: I love being able to have another place to store photos and also easily order prints. The other amazing thing is that I have it as a screensaver for all our TVs in the house with the fire stick. So we get so see our amazing family photos on our big TVs. Waking in a room and seeing my adorable granddaughters photos is better then walking in a room and seeing the television on some stupid commercial!  We find ourselves not turning a program on until the slide show is over!! Lol
title: Love it!!

review: I tell everyone I know about this app! It‚Äôs a blessing to have somewhere to safely store your videos & pictures! I love using with my Echo Show as a digital frame!! The only negative thing is the ‚Äúpeople‚Äù at the bottom‚Ä¶.you can‚Äôt see them well. Always a helpful thing when you need pictures  for a  birthday, a death or looking for a specific picture to look for the person & then all the photos pop up! Just please change them back to large tiles so we can use this perk üòâ
title: Love love love this app!

review:
Removing the search function from the app is a severe setback. I can‚Äôt even find pictures of my cats any longer because 1) I can‚Äôt simply search for ‚Äúcat‚Äù like I used to and 2) when I go filter by ‚Äúthing‚Äù cat is not an option, but you don‚Äôt even know this because you have to go through the whole list of prefiltered options (which are meaningless to my use and experience). 
Suggestion: stop thinking you know what the customer wants and give the customer options to filter their photos as they‚Äôd like.
title: Bring back search function

review: Super convenient to access all my photos and sync all my devices from anywhere with an internet connection but the facial recognition feature needs attention. Currently it is unable to unassociate incorrect facial recognition, unable to tag, and unable to bypass people in the background.  The search also works well for the items picture but not for the pictures info such as basic file attributes.  So, I really like the app but would like to love it if these features were better developed.
title: Would like to love it

review:
I use this for my big storage of photos, but I wish I could save all my videos! I still pay Dropbox for that. My daughter is a singer, so I have every performance of hers saved on video. There isn‚Äôt an option to upgrade video storage here, either, which is unfortunate. 

Sorting & storing photos is better than it used to be, but searching is a bit clumsy. I have just gotten to where I use this as my ‚Äúset & forget‚Äù backup for photos... it backs up daily & I only use it for photos. I have to manually back up my videos to Dropbox, but at least I have that organized better.
title: Generally great, but...

review: I like it a lot except when I first downloaded it I had to get 3000+ photos off my phone. It downloaded some but not all. Now I have to sort through which were downloaded and which I can‚Äôt delete off my phone yet. Going forward it should be easy to keep track of but not easy in the beginning. I also like that it will keep photos from both my husband‚Äôs phone and mine so all of them are in 1 location.
title: Great except it doesn‚Äôt delete photos off device

review: I love Prime Photos! I use iCloud as well, but don‚Äôt feel confident that it‚Äôs backing everything up, even though I pay for additional storage. Prime backs up without fail when I open the app and am connected to Wi-Fi. I love the ability to sort and search too, also the ease of downloading and sharing. Very user friendly! I also love the unlimited storage for photos. Hands down, this is the best cloud storage for photos and videos. I highly recommend it!
title: Best Cloud service for photos!

review:
Things work exceptionally well until I found two bugs. 
1. It kept showing xx photos left for backup even though I have enough video storage left. Not sure if this is related with IOS 11 as those photos were taken with my new iPhone 8 plus. 
2. The combine faces feature does not work for me. I could select faces to combine and was asked to enter name for the person. However, the ‚ÄúOK‚Äù is not clickable so I have to click cancel to go back.
Not sure if anyone has either of the same issue.
title: Love everything except some bugs

review:
Great storage only problem is when I want to get in touch with somebody do you have a question or add to my storage I don‚Äôt know who to call .
It says unlimited pictures, which is not true. I understand if they cannot upload my videos and there is a limit to that but pictures are unlimited and this is not the fact I have prime photos for past five years at least or maybe more and they haven‚Äôt been uploaded for past two years, it‚Äôs keep pausing the upload for the pictures and it says you have to buy more storage which this is not what Prime is all about
title: Great

review:
I love that my photos and videos are automatically backed up at a much more affordable price than similar offerings from Apple. 

Unfortunately, the app experience is pretty poor.  Videos often fail to load, some random Live Photos won‚Äôt play for no apparent reason, and the app completely freezes often and you have to restart and find where you were before to continue.  

These problems have existed for years now and those bugs should have been squashed by now.
title: Love the service, but the app needs work.

review:
Unlimited photo and 5 gig of video storage? Can‚Äôt beat it!
I used this for transferring my photos and videos from my Samsung Galaxy into my new iPhone. For anyone who‚Äôs switched that direction (droid to iOS) you know Apple doesn‚Äôt make it easy. Install the app, upload, install the app, download. Simple!
I can‚Äôt attest to the printing service, yet, but the prices seem pretty good. I‚Äôm looking forward to (finally) getting some prints made.
title: Great service for Prime Member

review: I spend a lot of time preserving memories and I‚Äôm grateful for the ease of saving pictures.  However, printing can be frustrating at times.  The edit/crop/rotate doesn‚Äôt always work.  Also there is a check mark in the upper right hand corner and a done in the bottom right corner.  There have been times I clicked on ‚Äúdone‚Äù thinking it meant I was done with my selection/editing or by accident and I lose all of the pictures I just edited.  (But that is partially user error.)
title: Love the ease of saving pictures but printing can be difficult

review:
The quality and quantity of photos stored is excellent! It is easy to access and forward, email or share. Perhaps too easy to share as usually others can access all your photos whether you select and remove the qualifying hashtags to see all Photos, or not!  This can
Be a privacy issue so check what you're doing and where you save the photos; it is better to send from separate albums you create.
Otherwise useful photo storage app.
title: Great app but too easy for others to access all photos not just selected

review: I started using the app as a way to back up photos. My biggest complaint is that seemingly the only way to add more space by upgrading my subscription is to cancel, wait for it to expire, then re-subscribe. That makes me nervous when it‚Äôs my photos at stake if I forget to sign back up. It would be nice to be able to pick a new plan and have it automatically start when the old plan expires. I‚Äôm trying to give more money and you make it difficult. Makes it tempting to just pay for iCloud instead‚Ä¶
title: Overall an okay app

review:
She‚Äôs a any chihuahua puppy we just bought her she has a bug crawling in her heresrsshe is a total mess ! I am lomuchinlove with her !feeling bad for her !!!!!!!! We have rented giving her baths and taking her to the vet she has had all of her shots dewormed full of worms omg!‚Äô!!!!!!! title: Full of bugs this person should not be slowed to have Otto sale

review: Love how easy it is to backup, purchase prints, and reload on other devices. The search function is great (I‚Äôd give that a 8/10) for when I‚Äôm looking for something specific. I do wish there was like a filter for similar pictures so I could clean things up a bit. They just added a new purchase option for more video storage which was long awaited. I recommend this to a lot of friends. I don‚Äôt even use iCloud storage for pictures anymore.
title: So convenient

review: This was my first time ordering online and I was very pleased with my photos so I will be back and older and more. The first time was just a few to see how I like them but I was very satisfied other than the ones I had enlarged 2557 same to cut the head off when I dragged it on the bone the head was on there but when the picture came the head was cut up so I‚Äôll try again. Thank you for the service.
title: Photos

review: It‚Äôs not the most elegant photos app, but it integrates well with your Echo Show display and has unlimited free photo backup from your phone. Use it with the 8‚Äù Echo Show, the 5‚Äù Echo Show is not as good (dark screen, small screen, poor microphone pick up). Wait for a sale on the Echo Show 8‚Äù to pair with this, I‚Äôve seen two for one deals on it. The best part is having these photos pop-up on your device so you can relive forgotten memories from years past. If you have years and years of photos this set-up is a delight. My wife loves it ‚ô•Ô∏è
title: Prime member must have

review:
I wanted to use this as my key photo backup and organization app since I have a prime account, but this app doesn‚Äôt have even the basic of photo organization features. I would expect at least a property editor for photo name or manual entry of tags, which would then allow me to search for photos by said tags. But this app is purely just a upload and manual visual search app, which is not useful if you have tons of pictures. 

 I think I will uninstall or disable this app until those essential features are implemented.
title: Missing a lot of key features: Can‚Äôt change title, add custom tags

review: I like having my photos in the cloud and use them for my screensaver on my fire tv. I am still not sure how to navigate the entire app because photos keep showing up that I couldn‚Äôt find before or ones I‚Äôm sure I deleted. It should give you an option to not upload videos because it tells me on my phone that it has paused uploads due to running out of video room. But I thought photos were unlimited so I‚Äôm confused. Maybe I just know what I‚Äôm doing. ;~)
title: It all good.

review: If you have prime this is one of the best features that you could use. You could save all your photos at the maximum resolution. In the past it used to be difficult to separate videos from the photos. Now with the new web interface it is very easy to download all the videos and delete them so you could keep on backing up your videos from your phone into this app.
title: Excellent value with prime

review:
I was a little skeptical about using the storage for my pictures at first. Then after I tried it found that it is very easy to use and I can go through all my pictures and videos to clear out the ones I don‚Äôt want. It‚Äôs very handy if I want to order prints or need help with anything. 
Keep up the good work and please don‚Äôt change anything as it‚Äôs great for us elderly people to use.
title: Handy & easy to use

review: The new 8.0 update has been touted as as making it easier than ever to find your photos. I disagree. I find the navigation counter intuitive. The old ‚Äúsearch‚Äù bar was magical! I could type ‚ÄúSedona‚Äù and see all photos taken in Sedona Arizona. Now, I have to scroll though a forever list of metadata.  Then, to do something simple, like create a slide show of all images in an album‚Ä¶ good luck. Can‚Äôt figure that out either. It‚Äôs so disappointing because I love this feature of Prime, but I want the old app back‚Ä¶
title: Love the storage, navigation is horrible

review: That‚Äôs the worst re-design I‚Äôve ever experienced, not intuitive and lacking important features that the previous app had. The claim in the update description states that it‚Äôs now easier to find photos the user is looking for, and the redesigned app doesn‚Äôt have a normal search anymore. I tried to find pics from a certain year and location that I was able to do within seconds before, spending several minutes, but still couldn‚Äôt find the place in the new places offerings. Removing a simple search functionality is a deal-breaker for me, and I‚Äôll start looking for an alternative to manage my photos.
title: Awful redesign

review: The app is nice. It could be nicer with a few improvements. I have pics on several different devices, so not sure what I‚Äôve uploaded and not. I upload entire folders and unless they are named the same it cannot detect same pictures. It would be nice if it could... I mean it can recognize same faces why not entire images. Maybe it can and I just haven‚Äôt found the feature idk. Also, lately I have been getting a lot of ‚Äòunable to download‚Äô messages when trying to download a photo to my phone.... its annoying, please resolve it. Otherwise, great app.
title: Good but needs work

review: Basically I like the app as long as I have an internet connection (I don't have unlimited data and don't want to use it to upload photos). Being able to upload photos when I'm traveling gives me a sense of security and let's me keep my phone clear for taking more photos. Too slow to download to the phone though so I wait till I get home to pick out those special pics. And, since it comes with Prime I may as well use it rather than pay some other service.
title: A bit slow from phone

review:
I LOVE this ability to organize & archive our photos in the cloud. A couple of suggestions would get you my 5th star . . .

‚Ä¢ Thank you for allowing me to have my family join me. It would be better if ALL of us could see, share, & organize the albums. (I was shocked when we couldn‚Äôt.)

‚Ä¢ If we could edit the date & location info on photos. Everything comes in as today where I currently am, but we‚Äôre often converting old photos to digital & it would be great if we could change the data to what it actually was.

‚Ä¢ Along the same lines, it‚Äôd be great if there was a way to attach a note to a photo - like the notes my mom wrote on the back. Some of the notation would be accomplished by tagging who‚Äôs in the photo & editing the date & location. But a note field would allow us to capture things like ‚Äúready for the race‚Äù or whatever.
title: Wonderful App

review: I started using this ap as a free promotional thing. Never thought I would ever need it. Long story short someone stole my phone my iPhone stopped saving my photos to the cloud because I didn‚Äôt pay for storage & I thought all of my new born babies pictures were gone for life. I remembered I downloaded this checked & they are all on here & I am beyond thankful that I have those memories forever now. Thank you
title: Saved my life

review: I love the idea of this app. I would like to see auto upload and uploading when app is in the background. There is also a limit on videos which is inconvenient. I don't have excessive videos but they have stopped uploading them on my devices because I have reached my limit. If these things changed I would rate 5 stars. It's good but could be better. Aside from those things the app works great. The pictures are organized and clearly visible.
title: Useful app

review:
ü§¨So I‚Äôm not home and I am on vacation a couple thousand miles from my home I took a lot of pictures and my phone was getting full so I remembered I could upload my pictures to my Alexa but since I‚Äôm on vacation and download the app and try to sign in it flagged me as fraud because of my location so now I have to wait till I get home before I can sign into this app -meanwhile my phone is full and I can‚Äôt take any more pictures so there‚Äôs lots of memories I can‚Äôt have because I relied on this stupid app to help me out üò°üò°üò°
- It also said it was going to send me a confirmation email so I could use the app and it never did that either
title: Don‚Äôt get if your mat at home

review: I love this app I just wish I could get more options without having to pay for more of the options. Can I get more of the options in the pro? There‚Äôs some that would be awesome but I just can‚Äôt get them without having to buy them I don‚Äôt have to have all just a few more then what y‚Äôall have that‚Äôs not in the pro. Please do add more it would be so much better. Thank You for sharing this app with me
title: Photo

review: I have two other photo album apps I use.  They‚Äôre intuitive and simple to work through.  I‚Äôve been waiting for four days for this app to load selected pictures. There are a lot of pix so knew it would take a while‚Äî but four days?  My other photo album apps  are able to load my pix within a few minutes, even when there are over a hundred pix.  To even get to the upload option isn‚Äôt immediately apparent.   Also just read the info it‚Äôs collecting on me‚Ä¶ my financial and contact information??  I guess too busy mining my device for personal information to load a picture.
title: Worst photo app I‚Äôve used

review:
I have three sons with very, very  similar features, and their sister does as well.  The facial recognition of this app was correct about 75% of the time, which you would find incredible if you scrolled through pictures of the 4 of them from birth until today when they are respectively 21, 19, 17 and 14.
My only wish would be for some expanded functionality when accessing this app on a Smart TV, but I‚Äôm entirely delighted with this version right now.
title: Quite close to perfect

review: This app would be the absolute best for storage it worked as great as it could all the time not just when it wants to! There‚Äôs rare days where it‚Äôll upload my pictures and videos no problem but most days it‚Äôll say x amount of items are being uploaded and they don‚Äôt upload and the app will crash and not upload anything else for days. I have to constantly sign out and delete to re-download and sign back in just to continue the process :( it‚Äôs sooooo frustrating
title: It‚Äôs amazing when it wants to be

review: I downloaded this app to store photos from my phone. It‚Äôs very easy to use in that regard and is able to accommodate all my photos, however, it has very limited video storage. I do love the memories feature (showing photos that were taken on this day in previous years), but I think it has a long way to go when it comes to sharing those photos. I can‚Äôt seem to pull them up to edit them or view them full sized. All in all, it‚Äôs a nice free app that stores my photos safely.
title: Great for storage, not for sharing

review: The title says it. We use this app for family photo storage going back decades. The next additional feature is the "this day in history" where you see photos from prior years. It used to be such that all people h hooked in to the account could use this feature, but a recent update made it so only the primary account holder can see it. Mom and grandma are not impressed. I‚Äôd raise my review back to five stars if they added the feature back in. Beyond that I‚Äôm not convinced it‚Äôs any better or worse than any other photo storage app.
title: Latest update removed memories for family members

review: I am a grandma who loves to take pictures of my kids and grands! I use my phone to take my pictures and they save right into the app. I have printed 5x7 and 4x6 and the come out beautifully. The colors are wonderful and it lets you know if the picture would be blurry. Hands down better than going to a store, connecting your phone and trying to print! I will never do that again!
title: Easy to print

review: This update is a joke! The worst update ever! I would give it zero stars if I could!! I used to love being able to go back and find old photos, but since this update I can‚Äôt find anything I am looking for. No search button??? Such a shocker in this day and age. Terrible terrible idea!  Canned words that have nothing to do with what I am looking for?  I couldn‚Äôt even find the word horse!  Such huge leap backwards and the ultimate disappointment.  This is utter garbage ! Who would think this is ok? If you were forced to do it this way, why not at least have the words alphabetical so you could find anything ? Huge mistake! It‚Äôs free and I want my money back!
title: Hot steaming garbage!!!

review:
Wasted a lot of real estate on automatic memories for small phones, especially for a controversial feature. 

Non-intuitive to find albums shared WITH you. 

Still does not add images from shared albums to other photos apps easily. Bad design for accessing/viewing/ordering pictures from shared groups. Why does every photo have the name of the person who uploaded it, blocking half the image in the main summary screen? I don‚Äôt care who added the photo; I care about the cute kid obscured by the text!
title: Bad redesign for small phones, not great shared album use

review: Considering that this is a free way to store your photos at full resolution, I've got no complaints. The facial recognition needs a bit of work to get going. You have to add pictures to family vault first or it doesn't seem to activate the facial recognition. Be careful also, once you set someone's face to a name, there seems to no easy way to edit. Overall, free and unlimited storage deserves 5 stars. All the "negative" things are really not big deal.
title: Facial Recognition Buggy

review: If we could just make our own folders and file system this would be perfect! Many of my photos are scanned from pre digital pictures and the dates are all wrong since they are filed by scan date. And, I miss my desktop app where I could fix them. Not everyone has all their pics on their phone.
title: Love the app but wish we could make our own folders

review:
The memories section just stopped working and won‚Äôt load anymore. I get a loading error message every time I try. Also the this day in the past also always fails to load for me. I tried to go into the help and feedback section of the app, but only a blank white screen will load. Fix all of these things and I will give it a five star rating.

Update: logging in again fixed the problems.
title: Broken, needs work

review:
I love it as a back up to my iphone, my iCloud tends to get full pretty promptly so it‚Äôs easy to delete pictures knowing that they are backed up on here. It‚Äôs great being able to have my picture show up on our TV as a screen saver especially order memories, it's like have a giant electronic picture frame. 
Overall a great app, would had given it a 5 star review, however it be wonderful if it would also include unlimited video backup as well.
title: Great photo storage

review: The ability to have your photos accessible to share on all your devices is a big plus, and the facial recognition is great, but a little glitchy. Unfortunately, there‚Äôs no ability to attach descriptions to a photo without inserting text into the picture itself. Also, while you can assign the date the picture was taken, but you can‚Äôt state the date simply as a year or month; it requires a specific day, which implies a degree of accuracy that might not be known.
title: Room for improvement

review: This was formerly a useful good app but the latest release turned it into a crappy slideshow generator. With the latest pathetic release, you can no longer search for a keyboard of your choosing. You can filter to a few preselected and inane terms, like ‚Äòplant‚Äô or ‚Äòbikini‚Äô, but you can‚Äôt pick your own search word like ‚Äòapple‚Äô or ‚Äòtractor‚Äô. If you need to find a specific photo out of thousands, you are out of luck, the new version makes this impossible. I can‚Äôt believe the designers could blunder this badly and treat the users with such disrespect. This is no longer a viable phone app, it is now pointlessly and thoughtlessly broken.
title: App ruined by removal of search function

review: I have prime through my student discount and it's honestly the best thing ever. Years ago I used to use Photobucket to save pictures, but that was a huge hassle. I'm all about inconvenience and what makes my life easier. I don't even have to do anything, the photos in my photo album automatically back up to this app. I don't see how you can rate it anything other than 5 stars since it does what it says it'll do. Unlimited photo storage, how can you beat that?
title: Love it

review: This app is amazing! I had over 22,000 pictures/videos on my phone, and this app has backed them all up in full resolution in way less time then I thought. (Took about two days). The photos and videos are easy to access after uploading. And I love the auto upload, and the night setting. I highly recommend this app to anyone who is looking for quality, and easiness.
title: Peace of mind!

review: It‚Äôs easy to use and saving beautiful memories of wife makes me feel so happy and blessed thank you I miss my wife every single second of each day but thank you for helping me with this and showing a memory every day gives me a big smile and my my heart feel the love we always have for each other and also always stronger than ever until I see my Jacqueline again thank you
title: Giuseppe Jackie Lubrano

review: This app may be enough for majority of people, but for photographers there is still a lot to be desired.  The metadata of the images in this app only shows basic information like date and filename, and that‚Äôs it.  Compared to Google Photos, Google provides more metadata info like focal range, iso, aperture, and camera model, and all these info are searchable in app.  So, if image metadata is important to you, then look somewhere else.  But if you just want to backup your images, then this app should be fine.
title: Need more details in image metadata

review: I‚Äôve been looking for photo storage for awhile and even though I have prime, I thought I had to pay for it. Turns out I don‚Äôt for photos but I did have to buy extra storage for my videos (reason for 4 stars). Other than that, I think it‚Äôs a great app. It stores my photos which is exactly what I need. I also like how it automatically backs up the photos in my phone. I‚Äôve used it to edit photos and download them and both work fine.
title: Stores my photos

review:
I am indebted to Prime Photos. I downloaded on my new phone and photos and videos came back that I had forgotten about or couldn‚Äôt remember even taking. Like my youngest daughter baby shower of her first and only child. Pictures of my oldest grandchildren that was forgotten. 
Thank you Prime Photos for bringing some joy back into my Life during the times when I couldn‚Äôt see my family up close and personal. 
üíúüåπüéâüí™
title: Memories

review: Easy to use, seamless in uploading my photos automatically. Love the ‚ÄúOn this day‚Äù reminders - I actually get to see those pics from days past. My only issue is that the process of selecting pics to order is a little cumbersome and it‚Äôs not always clear if you‚Äôve added additional pictures properly. But the overall process of going from photo to order is easy.
title: Great app

review: This app has helped me have all my photos in one place despite changing phones several times in the last few years. Its very convenient to have them all on the cloud and readily accessible whenever I need them. I also love the features that bring up memories from previous years and trips. Its also nice to be able to search for things like ‚Äúdog‚Äù or ‚Äúmountain‚Äù within my own pictures.
title: Super convenient and easy to use!

review:
I love this so far . the only thing keepin it from getting the 5th star is that the fire stick can only be set to start  the slide show   5,10, or 15 minutes after no  activity. (or never) .
Then the slideshow of my pics only runs for 2 or 3 minutes then it stops and the fire stick goes to sleep? make the screen dark . I would like to just have it  run the slideshow till I make it stop . 
but it did really help me organize my thousands of photos .
title: I love it‚Ä¶.. But

review: Don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôd do without Prime. It keeps all my photos available quickly with much less space taken up in my phone. It‚Äôs holding 4 years of photos and I shoot a lot. It‚Äôs much much better than iCloud that takes ur photos and takes forever to re download them. Prime is a continuous photo album of the photos u choose taking very little space! None of this low resolution copies or forever downloads...it makes life easy and better
title: The Best

review:
I‚Äôve already sold my soul to prime for everything from household needs, to nutritional supplements, to gifts‚Ä¶ I was thrilled to discover a photo storage WAS INCLUDED! 
It‚Äôs been easy to use. It‚Äôs easy to keep new photos updated. Then I just delete them from my phone & I'm not using (paying extra) for iCloud storage! I love that! 
I‚Äôve also had need to find picks & share them, that was an easy process as well.
title: Saves my iCloud

review: We use this app all the time.  I love the facial recognition that automatically groups my photos by person.  I wish there was a way to change a grouped picture to another person.  Multiple‚Äôs run in my family and they are too close for facial recognition.  Free photo storage with prime membership plus easy availability to order photos.  Hopefully photo books & calendar projects will be available one day.

review: Had it for under a week. A bit cumbersome to send a photo via e-mail. Have to either send a link or download the photo first. Wish you could grab and drop. Or just embed the photo in an e-mail. Love all the storage it frees up on my phone and computer, while still able to easily access my photos! It has a lot of features that I like from iPhotos- like facial recognition, and adds fun ones like: photos with drinks or dogs or such.

review: I love that I can put my photos and videos somewhere other then my phone and computer. The only and biggest downfall is it takes forever for videos to save. I have 11 that have been trying to save for several weeks now. I‚Äôve only used half my storage and I‚Äôve tried saving using my carrier, Wi-Fi, even really fast Wi-Fi. I‚Äôm the kind of person that doesn‚Äôt have notifications on my phone so it drives me crazy that it shows notifications that there was a problem.
title: Good for photos but not videos‚Ä¶.

review: I thought I had los hundred of pics I could not find in my cloud account or on my pad. I downloaded this App and there they were. I cried because I was so thrilled to have them back.  I I bought a new iPad twice this month and had to transfer all my data to each one. I‚Äôm 72 years old and it‚Äôs the easiest app I have ever used. My pics are totally organized and so are my albums.
title: In love with this Photo App

review: I love the ease of maintaining all photos and videos in one account. It would be nice if there was easier access to shared photos - a way to delete junk photos from a shared file (like when my husband uploads 50 pictures of a floor that our two year old took). Would also be nice to select and save multiple photos from the shared album as easily as you can from individual / owners albums.
title: Easier access for shared photos

review: Not sure how I didn‚Äôt find this benefit earlier but it‚Äôs nice. Unlimited photo uploads is such a great way to keep your photos in an additional place. Uploads photos automatically when you open the app as long as there is Wi-Fi or data I believe. Highly recommend and comes with prime membership for free. The video uploads stops at 5GB which isn‚Äôt a lot but you can always buy more storage if needed.
title: So far so good

review: I was skeptical at first. Another place to store photos? Why? Well, iCloud Drive and One Drive love to fight each other and I‚Äôm frankly sick of both. I‚Äôve lost data due to their constant failing updates. This has none of that fighting for control.  Granted it only saves photos (unlimited) and videos (for a price). It also organizes everything for you and you can customize things further.
title: I‚Äôm sold on it

review: The previous version of the app, while not entirely intuitive, was functional and worked fine. The recent update makes it harder to find photo streams. Also, it looks like there‚Äôs a bug, because now there‚Äôs no way to like individual photos. When you like a photo, it likes all photos for that post. Once you like a photo, there‚Äôs also an indicator saying there‚Äôs a comment on the photo even when there‚Äôs no comment. I wish they would have stuck with the previous interface and just integrated the machine learning on top of it rather than trying to completely redesign the UI.
title: Why the ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù?

review: This app works great for streaming your photos to a Fire TV!  We have thousands of photos that were just sitting on or iPhones and iPads.  I wanted a device where I could just glance up while walking by and see my kids, grandkids or places we‚Äôd traveled and just be reminded at random, of our lives!  This is perfection!  Our smaller 32 inch Fire TV is hung above our large tv and constantly streams my photos!  I love this!!
title: Great Photo Streaming App

review: The fact you can use multiple devices ‚Äúmy phone, iPad, pc‚Äù I have pictures on all three and it‚Äôs wonderful. You can use up to 6 I think not sure on that but it is nice. This program was recommended to me by an expert of sorts and it has been great. I strongly recommend it to anyone that takes a ridiculous amount of pictures each month. Oh did I mention you can make albums! Love it!
title: Love the yearly calendar and month to month!

review: I got the app because what‚Äôs more tempting than displaying your favorite pics on the big screen, right?  Think again. The app is somewhat complicated and in no time you have it downloading thousands of pics from your phone. If you use them for your screensaver they will gum up your fire stick. After downloading pics I had that darn little circle going round and round and could not get anything to work. After a couple of calls to tech support they had me reset the fire stick to factory settings. Lost all my favorite settings including Kodi. Now I have to start all over again... think twice before getting this app
title: Think long and hard before you do this...

review:
Really there‚Äôs only a couple things I‚Äôd like that others already mentioned..  it would be good to be able to correct the face recognition when it‚Äôs wrong. This happens often. And it would be nice to be able to rotate the image from the app. (Great if it, like google, actually pointed out the pics that might need a flip). To delete pics from the main area when making albums. And to alert to duplicate photos being stored/about to be stored. 

The one thing I don‚Äôt see others mentioning that really is my biggest prob with this app, is the having to leave the app open fir it to store/upload my photos. That‚Äôs a real PITA. Can‚Äôt it happen in the background? As a pic is taken?
That would be nice. 

I use this because I get it with prime. But it is my backup of a back up. (Google photos  is just a better app at this point.)
title: Mostly fine

review: I like the unlimited photo storage for Prime members.  The app is fine for that purpose, but it could use a number of features to really make it a useful tool.  A bulk uploaded would be nice for uploading directories of photos and keeping the structure within albums.  That is, the album retains the directory name.  A lightroom uploaded would be sweet.  Also, album sorting options would be great beyond the two offered.  Reverse chronological order, reverse file name, etc.  drag and drop sorting would be nice, as well.

review: This app used to work great for sharing pictures between family members via the Family Vault. The latest update removed the ability to upload individual photos to the family vault, instead your only option is to batch upload your entire photo library. Support seems to think they‚Äôre helping by continually sending either 1. The old instructions for individually uploading which don‚Äôt work anymore or 2. Instructions for batch uploading all photos. A very disappointing update to what was a useful feature. Hope it is added back in in a new update.
title: Update Screwed Up Family Vault

review: I love this app for storing all my photos and I especially like the ability to create photo albums to sort all my photos for easy access. The only feature I would like to add would be the ability to upload from your ‚Äúfavorites‚Äù folder on your iPhone instead of only camera roll or collections. This would be nice for quick access to my best photos in one place. Other than that though, love the app!
title: Excellent App

review: I had Dropbox before, and granted I could also save files to it, I mostly used it for photos and videos and was paying over $150 a year for my storage. title: Fantastic way to save photos and videos cheaply!

review: This app has given my family cherished memories that at times we have forgotten and then on certain days it reminds us and brings a smile to our faces and floods those memories back to us and we sit and talk about that day or that moment, we would like to say thank you for helping us to remember to slow down at times and just take in the moments that we have and hold them a little closer and keep them in our hearts.
title: Memories

review: It does what it's suppose too. Some of the features are pretty standard compare to other photo services, but I would like to see it differentiate itself from other apps. I do like how you can search objects and the app can identify them in your photos. My favorite is to search for my dogs. Face recognition technology is mostly accurate, but it's still gets it wrong some time. You definitely need to use this benefit if your a prime member.
title: So far so good

review:
This app provides infinite photo storage with simple to use features including search, sharing, albums, memories.

Searching is incredibly easy you can search by date or for an individual‚Äôs face. This will help you find the photo you are looking for quickly.
My favorite feature is memories the app will surprise you periodically with a ‚Äúthis day ‚Äú it‚Äôll send you a notification that contains all the pictures from a date in your photo catalog. 

There is however one downside to this app. If your service is spotty it takes a long time to load all of your photos. I feel the ease of uploading the photos counters the lag in certain situations.

Overall this product has been a great boon to our family members. It‚Äôs easy to use for everyone and you can share memories easily.

review:
Love how we can instantly download all our pictures anywhere! And make an album just as quick. 
I'm not a tech person, so I'm easily pleased when it comes to getting my photos on my TV to use for my class presentations (history teacher). I find images, photo-shot them, download them, put them in an album, take fire stick to school, and use my remote to show pictures as I teach! Love it!!!
title: Works perfect with our Fire stick!

review:
Although I‚Äôve only developed a handful of photos, I‚Äôm happy with the results.  The photos turned out great.  I look forward to using other options to create gifts for family members. 

Additionally, the daily notification of memories always makes me smile.  Look forward to viewing the photos and seeing how much my family has changed over years.
title: So far great results!

Or, I would like to be able to sort the albums reverse-alphabetically/numerically so that if I make an album 2019-January, it will appear at the top of my album feed.

It did take a while to load it all, probably a few days and via desktop.
title: Easy and no glitches like google

review:
I really like this app because it‚Äôs free and gives unlimited storage for photos! The set up is pretty good for being new. 

There are a few things that I wish would change. I don‚Äôt know why they can‚Äôt back up photos in the background without the app being open, although I do like that they added an overnight feature to help with that. 
Also, it‚Äôs too bad they don‚Äôt take unlimited videos. I have to find another app for that. I do wish they had features for keeping photos in the ‚Äúfolders‚Äù they are in on my phone.

  Also the app somehow deleted all of my hidden pictures. It said they were backed up, so I deleted the photos. Went back to find the photos a week or two later, and they were gone. Very sad, considering that was all the personal photos from my honeymoon. 

Overall a good app but needs some changes.

review: This is a great app for storing photos, however I wish there was a way to import albums already on your phone directly from your phone into the app instead of having to upload the photos into the app and then again into a ‚Äúnew album‚Äù within the app. A lot of the albums in my phone are made up of pictures with drastically different date/time stamps and it‚Äôs very difficult to track them down in prime photos to put them into an album (essentially re-creating the album that‚Äôs already on my phone).

review: Fast as can be imports of all your images from every device you plug into all your devices! Other than that‚Ä¶..Awesomeness üòÅ

review: Can‚Äôt seem to get it to help carry bags into the house but it still works! Lol it‚Äôs an app to VIEW my photos! How can It be BAD or GOOD?? You OPEN the app and if you can VIEW your photos, BOOM 5 ‚ú®‚Äôs , if you TRY to OPEN the app and , O wait, I can‚Äôt rate it if it DOES NOT OPENüòÇüòÇüòÇ having WAYYYYYY too much fun with this REVIEW! Lol hope it makes WHOMEVER reads this review, I hope it brings you a refreshing, real quick, chuckle and SMILE for the day ! S.N. did I use WHOMEVER correctly???  I been in QUARANTINE wayyyyy to long it seems like!!!
title: Photos

Here‚Äôs why I took off one star: There is no way for me to pluck out that photo and drop it back into my device photos app. I can airdrop it to, say, my iPhone and it goes into the photo app there. But the only option on the device is to ‚Äúdownload‚Äù the picture. Well, I tried that, and it‚Äôs like it disappeared into the void. I have no idea where ‚Äúdownload‚Äù leads to. I looked and it‚Äôs not in‚Ä¶downloads! 

I also tried the ‚Äúhold down to save image‚Äù action, but that‚Äôs not a function, either.

Let me select photos to send directly to my photos app, and this would be 5 stars from me.

I am disabled and can only use my voice to navigate the app; by removing the search option the app is now extremely difficult and frustrating to use.
title: Update removes search option

review:

First of all, I disabled the auto-save feature as I want to control what photos I want to upload. I have hundred of photos!

And after some photos are uploaded, I have no idea from the list of photos which ones have already been uploaded! So this means next time I try to upload, I am clueless on which files are new and need upload!

review: This ap is a great place to store memories to look back on. review: One desire:  I wish when albums were made‚Ä¶photos were directly accessed through those folders.  Just like a file folder in documents & photos on your computer.  Once you file it under a name, it is taken out of the main file so that there was more organization.
title: Love the accessibility and screen saver when a logged in on TV.

review: Having learned about this app I download it immediately. I‚Äôm grateful for his creation and usefulness. I‚Äôm grateful for its creation and it‚Äôs allowing me to keep my phone memory Available.
title: Great Memory Saver

review: My experience has been good with the photo app because I never realized until recently that there‚Äôs a competition or rival going up against Apple. Just because my phone is Apple does not mean I trust you guys to store my valued images. They‚Äôve lost one of my grand girl sitting next to my late sons grave. I don‚Äôt trust Apple now but I‚Äôve handed the reins to Google. Could you find another formatting option? Thanks
title: Photo

review:
I recommend a ‚ÄúSearch‚Äù feature be added so you can search for ‚ÄúPeople‚Äù and ‚ÄúAlbums‚Äù by typing in a name. The feature used to be included but was removed with the update. 

For example, at present it is difficult to sort by a particular person/face, that has been tagged with a name. You have to scroll through all the faces to find the one you are searching for. If we could search by a name, the process would be much more efficient.

title: This App Is Great! (Read Before Downloading)

review: This app is excellent because it makes frequent updates into your photos storage and if you loose your phone you‚Äôll most likely not loose any pictures. It‚Äôs very easy to navigate and you can track back to a particular month of location when or where the picture was taken so you can navigate through your picture history easily and on the go..

I choose to use Prime as my mail means of photo back-up & storage. It‚Äôs easier for me to locate a photo quickly w/n the App to show a friend, share to social media, etc. otherwise, I‚Äôll be scrolling thru tiny thumbnails forever thru 100‚Äôs of pics to find what I‚Äôm looking for. All picture storage services usually have great formats for optimum organization. I personally like Prime Photos best & will
continue to use their services.

review: Life is made up of memories, and photos are one of the best connections to those memories. As such, it is so important to protect your photos. title: The future of photo storage!

review: I just downloaded this app so it won‚Äôt be fair to give it an honest rating while I‚Äôm still trying to understand what makes it different from Google or other picture apps I have I‚Äôm still trying to learn what makes it standout right now I don‚Äôt see much of a difference think it might be different but maybe I don‚Äôt know how to maneuver my way around.
title: Amazing

review: I have been using this App for the past 2 years and enjoy the daily memories notifications and days around features based on your photos. review: It seems to keeping my photos. I‚Äôm curious to see how long and if a higher price will be charged to access them later down the road. Only thing I would like to see improve is you have to have the app open to upload your pictures. I would like it to do it on the background. I can‚Äôt wait to see this app only get better!
title: So far good.

review: This is great. It loads right to my fireTV and my kids and sit and watch videos of themselves and look at all the places we have loved to. They always say they can‚Äôt wait to make new memories friends who are waiting for them at the next duty station.

AND I can order pictures in the same app. Although, quality of the printed photos could be better. It‚Äôs easy to maneuver but is timely when ordering prints. Overall, 9.5 out of 10!
title: Awesomeness

review:
We don‚Äôt own a home computer, so having a place that collects all of the photos I take with my phone and storing them for me gives me tremendous peace of mind. Love this app.
title: Very Helpful

Don‚Äôt have anything bad to say about the app. The app helps free up space on all my devices. Loading photos is easy, and the app is really user friendly.

title: Great Free Storage W/Prime

review:
Just know when my pictures are all backed up I‚Äôve seen it happen to people in the past and 55 but over the past five years I started really getting into the phone and using it taking pictures and doing everything everybody else is doing so I wouldn‚Äôt want to lose any of the pitches I like the app.
                                       Michael
title: I like the peace of mind

review:
Loves to crash while backing up pix. 

Also, is backing up well beyond 3x the amount of pix on my device. Some months ago, photos were all backed up, then one day the app doubled how many pics it "thought" I had, and as of today it's more than tripled. So, let's say I have a hundred pix (I have a lot more), at some point it started telling me that it had backed up those pix but has 100 more to finish backing up. Now it's telling me it has nearly 450 pix yet to back up and 400 pix are backed up successfully. But I only have (in this simplified example) 100 pics on my phone to back up. 

Maybe it has trouble with large libraries. 

Also, backing up is very slow. 

Will address other bugs I've found by updating this review when these, the largest of issues, are resolved.

review:
Great app and great features but lacks the biggest privacy concern. 

No password/face ID option to open the app and to view the photos. 

If someone can access your phone then they can access all your photos. Not just photos in your phone but all the photos in a whole. Photos that are not present in the phone but backed up in the previous/other phone can be easily accessed without any authentication. 

A simple login password/Face ID can overcome this issue. 

If featured, will surely be a 5 star app.
title: Biggest privacy concern. No login security.

Must have been in the ‚Äúcloud‚Äù?

review:
Very poorly written ap.  
When you look at a photo, there is no information as to where it is taken or if it has identified any people in the photo. 
Instead you have look in the places area or the people area. 
The people area shows every face seen in a photo whether you know them or not. You cannot hide unknown faces. 

If you just want free storage, then it‚Äôs great, but if you care about where it was taken and the identity of faces, then go to Google or Apple.
